title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement asebsadowski@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Adam Sadowski. Author, maintainer. University Guelph. Copyright holder, funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Sadowski (2024). megamation: Access 'DirectLine' Data Using 'Megamation API'. R package version 0.1.0, https://asadow.github.io/megamation/, https://github.com/asadow/megamation.
code: @Manual{,   title = {megamation: Access 'DirectLine' Data Using the 'Megamation API'},   author = {Adam Sadowski},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0, https://asadow.github.io/megamation/},   url = {https://github.com/asadow/megamation}, }

what: Access DirectLine Data Using the Megamation API
title: Access DirectLine Data Using the Megamation API
text: Authors: Adam SadowskiLicense: GPL (>= 3)

title: Access DirectLine Data Using the Megamation API
text: megamation provides R interface Megamation DirectLine via API.

title: Access DirectLine Data Using the Megamation API
text: can install released version megamation CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: Access DirectLine Data Using the Megamation API
Access DirectLine Data Using the Megamation API
text: two options. Either use mm_authorize(): run usethis::edit_r_environ() install API credentials .Renviron. Now megamation functions automatically use credentials, don’t expose code.

title: Access DirectLine Data Using the Megamation API
text: mm_data() downloads data tables R. provides informative R errors (alongside HTTP errors).
code: mm_data("status") #> ℹ Requesting... #> # A tibble: 9 × 3 #>   ampc_required description                              status #>   <chr>         <chr>                                    <chr>  #> 1 No            ADMIN HTML WORK ORDERS WAITING TO SCREEN AW     #> 2 Yes           Cancelled                                CA     #> 3 No            CLOSED                                   CL     #> 4 No            INITIATED                                I      #> 5 No            In Progress                              IP     #> 6 Yes           Returned from Trade                      RT     #> 7 No            SCHEDULED                                S      #> 8 No            TRANSFERED                               T      #> 9 Yes           Waiting for Trade                        WT mm_data("statuses") #> ℹ Requesting... #> ℹ NB: 1/1 requests returned errors or no data. #>  #> ── Errored ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> ✖ HTTP 404 Not Found. #> • This is not a valid web API endpoint.  #> GET https://api.megamation.com/uog/dl/statuses?ALLFIELDS=1 #> # A tibble: 0 × 0

title: Access DirectLine Data Using the Megamation API
text: mm_data() allows easily filter fields (columns).

title: Access DirectLine Data Using the Megamation API
text: mm_names() allows see columns can act filters.
code: mm_names("workorder") #> # A tibble: 39 × 4 #>    field           filter_enabled description               type           #>    <chr>           <lgl>          <chr>                     <chr>          #>  1 type            TRUE           Type                      VARCHAR(65531) #>  2 status          TRUE           Status                    VARCHAR(65531) #>  3 date            TRUE           Date - [Month][Day][Year] DATE           #>  4 submitted_by    TRUE           Submitted By              VARCHAR(65531) #>  5 priority        TRUE           Priority                  VARCHAR(65531) #>  6 building_id     TRUE           Building                  VARCHAR(65531) #>  7 eqp_no          TRUE           Equipment#                VARCHAR(65531) #>  8 assign_to       TRUE           Assign To                 VARCHAR(65531) #>  9 issue_to        TRUE           Issue To                  VARCHAR(65531) #> 10 contractor_name TRUE           Contractor Name           VARCHAR(255)   #> # ℹ 29 more rows

title: Access DirectLine Data Using the Megamation API
text: can use Megamation’s modifiers filter values. [] containing !! equal >> greater << less <> . example, supply <field> = "[]<value>" get rows <field> contains <value>. ’s request work orders containing trades ADMIN .
code: admin_and_it <- c("[]ADMIN", "[]IT")  mm_data("workorder", trade = admin_and_it) #> # Data Not Shown for Privacy

title: Access DirectLine Data Using the Megamation API
text: Avoid <> dates. Instead, use sequence R Date’s. ’s request work orders January, 2023.
code: jan_2023 <- seq.Date(   as.Date("2023-01-01"),   as.Date("2023-01-31"),   by = "day" )  mm_data("workorder", date = jan_2023) #> # Data Not Shown for Privacy

title: Access DirectLine Data Using the Megamation API
text: Please see package website: https://asadow.github.io/megamation/.

title: Access DirectLine Data Using the Megamation API
text: Please note megamation project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms. Feedback, bug reports (fixes!), feature requests welcome; file issues seek support .

title: Format sequence of dates — date_as_between_string
text: date_as_between_string() formats sequence dates single string represents sequence. purpose simplify request URL including DATE=X&DATE=Y&DATE=Z DATE = <>X,Z X<Y<Z. former repetitive invalid Megamation API.

title: Format sequence of dates — date_as_between_string
Format sequence of dates — date_as_between_string
text: .min minimum Date. .max maximum Date.

title: Format sequence of dates — date_as_between_string
text: single string formatted "<>MM-DD-YYYY,MM-DD-YYYY" "<>" modifiers means "-".

what: Format a list of parameters — format_params
title: Format a list of parameters — format_params
text: format_params() formats supplied name-value pairs toward creating valid readable Megamation URL.

title: Format a list of parameters — format_params
Format a list of parameters — format_params
text: endpoint API endpoint. example, "timecard" employee transactions, "workorder" work orders. endpoints listed https://apidocs.megamation.com/. ... <dynamic-dots> Name-value pairs filter request. name lower-case name field filter-enabled (Megamation's words, criteria). arguments processed rlang::quos() support unquote via !! unquote-splice via !!!.

title: Format a list of parameters — format_params
text: list parameter name-value pairs.

title: Format a list of parameters — format_params
code: from <- as.Date("2023-09-20") to <- as.Date("2024-10-20") date <- seq(from, to, by = "day") trade <- c("[]PCO", "[]DM") megamation:::format_params("workorder", date = date, trade = trade) #> $DATE #> <>09-20-2023,10-20-2024 #>  #> $TRADE #> [1] "[]PCO" "[]DM"  #>

what: Are there credentials on hand? — has_creds
title: Are there credentials on hand? — has_creds
text: credentials hand?

title: Are there credentials on hand? — has_creds
Are there credentials on hand? — has_creds
text: TRUE user MEGAMATION_KEY MEGAMATION_URL environment variables.

what: megamation: Access 'DirectLine' Data Using the 'Megamation API' — megamation-package
title: megamation: Access 'DirectLine' Data Using the 'Megamation API' — megamation-package
text: Tools accessing handling 'DirectLine' data using 'Megamation API' https://apidocs.megamation.com/. API allows users interact data programmatically, instead via 'DirectLine' software. package community-maintained officially supported Megamation https://megamation.com/-megamation/.

title: megamation: Access 'DirectLine' Data Using the 'Megamation API' — megamation-package
text: Maintainer: Adam Sadowski asebsadowski@gmail.com (ORCID) contributors: University Guelph [copyright holder, funder]

title: Install Megamation credentials — mm_authorize
text: mm_authorize() installs credentials megamation functions need , like mm_data(), can use automatically. Specifically, places Megamation API key base URL computer's megamation R package configuration files. , whenever package loaded, credentials available environment variables.

title: Install Megamation credentials — mm_authorize
Install Megamation credentials — mm_authorize
text: key Single string Megamation API key. url Single string Megamation API base URL.

title: Install Megamation credentials — mm_authorize
text: Writes MEGAMATION_KEY MEGAMATION_URL environment variables.

title: Install Megamation credentials — mm_authorize
Download data — mm_data
text: mm_data() downloads Megamation tables R. automatically Creates performs necessary API GET request(s) Extracts combines data API response(s) Informs data returned API errors

title: Download data — mm_data
Download data — mm_data
text: endpoint API endpoint. example, "timecard" employee transactions, "workorder" work orders. endpoints listed https://apidocs.megamation.com/. ... <dynamic-dots> Name-value pairs filter request. name lower-case name field filter-enabled (Megamation's words, criteria). arguments processed rlang::quos() support unquote via !! unquote-splice via !!!. allfields TRUE, return fields currently available endpoint.

title: Download data — mm_data
text: data frame class tbl_df containing requested data.

title: Download data — mm_data
code: if (FALSE) { # megamation:::has_creds() date <- seq.Date(as.Date("2023-01-01"), as.Date("2023-01-03"), by = "day") mm_data("timecard", date = date) }

what: Extract error body from a Megamation API response — mm_error_body
title: Extract error body from a Megamation API response — mm_error_body
text: mm_error_body() simply plucks detail list response body, Megamation's API includes informative error messages.

title: Extract error body from a Megamation API response — mm_error_body
Extract error body from a Megamation API response — mm_error_body
text: resp API response.

title: Extract error body from a Megamation API response — mm_error_body
text: string detail index named list (parsed response).

title: Extract error body from a Megamation API response — mm_error_body
code: fake_mm_resp <- httr2::response_json(   body = list(     detail = "This is a fake detail/message from the API's response."   ) ) megamation:::mm_error_body(fake_mm_resp) #> [1] "This is a fake detail/message from the API's response."

what: Get endpoint appendix (criteria, schema, labels) — mm_get_appendix
title: Get endpoint appendix (criteria, schema, labels) — mm_get_appendix
text: mm_get_appendix() returns user-supplied appendix.

title: Get endpoint appendix (criteria, schema, labels) — mm_get_appendix
Get endpoint appendix (criteria, schema, labels) — mm_get_appendix
text: endpoint API endpoint. example, "timecard" employee transactions, "workorder" work orders. endpoints listed https://apidocs.megamation.com/. appendix "criteria", "labels", "schema".

title: Get endpoint appendix (criteria, schema, labels) — mm_get_appendix
text: data frame class tbl_df containing endpoint's appendix.

title: Get Megamation key — mm_key
text: Get Megamation key

title: Get Megamation key — mm_key
Get Megamation key — mm_key
text: string value MEGAMATION_KEY environment variable error none exists.

title: List GET requests — mm_list_get_reqs
text: mm_list_get_reqs() returns necessary GET request(s) fetching supplied endpoint parameters. Multiple GET requests sometimes needed two reasons. One, Megamation support common ways separating multiple values field inside HTTP URL. ways include: using ,, e.g. ?x=1,2 using |, e.g. ?x=1|2 turning element parameter, e.g. ?x=1&x=2 Megamation, first two ways result 404 error. last way fetches data x 1 2 (1 2). Hence mm_list_get_reqs() defines separate GET requests value given parameter. Two, timecard endpoint unique separate GET requests must made separate years data (e.g. 2022 vs 2023). also automatically handled mm_list_get_reqs().

title: List GET requests — mm_list_get_reqs
List GET requests — mm_list_get_reqs
text: endpoint API endpoint. example, "timecard" employee transactions, "workorder" work orders. endpoints listed https://apidocs.megamation.com/. ... <dynamic-dots> Name-value pairs filter request. name lower-case name field filter-enabled (Megamation's words, criteria). arguments processed rlang::quos() support unquote via !! unquote-splice via !!!. allfields TRUE, return fields currently available endpoint.

title: List GET requests — mm_list_get_reqs
text: list GET requests class httr2_request.

title: List GET requests — mm_list_get_reqs
code: if (FALSE) { # megamation:::has_creds() date <- seq.Date(as.Date("2022-01-01"), as.Date("2023-01-31"), by = "day") megamation:::mm_list_get_reqs("timecard", date = date) }

what: Create a Megamation API request — mm_req
title: Create a Megamation API request — mm_req
text: mm_req() creates request using httr2::request() following: Inserts base URL using environment variable MEGAMATION_URL .Renviron. Appends URL endpoint defined parameter endpoint. Sets user-agent GitHub megamation package. Authenticates request HTTP basic authentication using environment variables MEGAMATION_KEY MEGAMATION_URL .Renviron. Handles HTTP errors useful information response extracted (e.g. "response body"). Adds caching responses available. See httr2::req_cache().

title: Create a Megamation API request — mm_req
